@Niquelandia With pseudonymity and anonymity, physical world entities and individuals can detach their identities from their virtual counterparts, making it extremely hard for any jurisdiction-based authority to pinpoint metaverse ‘lawbreakers’ in the the physical world.

“16,000 metaverse trademarks have been filed by Chinese companies”

Ironically, the metaverse is out of the jurisdiction of any government or authority, making legal enforcement near impossible.

@Blockworks_ Value /= Price

I’m not saying that NFTs don’t have a future. Just like ICOs, which are an extremely valuable capital raising mechanism. 

But in the current iteration it’s at, it’s mostly fluff. And when the time for people to pull some money comes, with no bids, they’ll sell cheap.

NFT crash, like the ICO crash.

Note: not a prediction, just a high probability scenario.

Fear to greed market cycle: 

Phase 1: Price follows fundamentals.
Phase 2: Price follows changes in fundamentals.
Phase 3: Price follows the anticipation of changes in fundamentals.
@EyalShay2 My wishes are perpetual.

People think that crypto is exempt from macro cycles without realising that crypto isn’t even old enough to have experienced a compete macro cycle yet.

Last recession: 2008 
Bitcoin founded: 2009
@manishbg It’s down to tradeoffs. They’ll have to pick the least shitty option.

Option 1: Control inflation -> Raise rates -> directly benefits the masses. 

Option 2: Don’t control inflation -> Keep rates low in order to maintain interest payments they have to make on their own debt (which amounts to $30T) -> directly benefits the market and themselves.

The fed is facing a double-edged sword, which at some point they’ll have to stab themselves with. 

An implosion is inevitable.

While markets might’ve priced in the impact of interest rate hikes on assets and their liquidity, they have not priced in the impact of interest rate hikes on the actual economy. 

P.S. economic impact affects the fundamentals of what underlies the assets.

@safetyth1rd I’ve been intermittent fasting on a 22-2 window for a long time now. Only one meal a day.

Isn’t just about the weight loss for me. It has long term benefits that you’d be shocked to hear for the minimal effort you have to put in.

Remember that an asset can lose 90% perpetually from any point it’s at.

I.e. just because you bought an asset after a 90% fall from its highs, doesn’t mean you’re protected from another 90% drawdown. 

I’d recommend evaluating the asset’s underlying reality instead of its price.

RT @himgajria: Rational players create bull markets, 
bull markets create irrational players, 
irrational players create bear markets, 
bea…

Bear markets aren’t just about drawdown size, but drawdown period as well. 

The longer they last, the greater the ‘rationalising impact’ they have on the market and its players.

12 rate hike cycles since WW2. 

11 of 12 cycles followed by recessions. 

13th rate hike cycle is inevitable.
